page.title: 13Yealmpton Railway
page.content: {Yealmpton Branch Line.} Riverside Walk, a housing estate was built in 1971, on the site of Yealmpton Station and goods yard. The G.W.R. constructed the line in 1897. The last public passenger train service operated on the 4th October 1947 and closure to goods traffic eventually followed on 29th February 1960. Services operated from Plymouth (Millbay) via Lipson Junction, Plymstock and Elburton. At steer point there was a connecting steam boat called 'the Kitley Belle' for passengers to Newton Ferrers.The Yealmpton branch line has now been lifted. The railway was commemorated on the 29th February 1980 by the erection of a plaque by the amenity society. It was unveiled by Mr William Dennis chairman of Yealmpton Parish Council
